snippet: RadioShack files for bankruptcy. | Ally Financial is looking to ramp up performance. | Pfizer makes a big bet on a new class of generics. | Dysfunction continues at GFI.

headline: After Shake-Up Last Year, Sanofi Names New Chief
snippet: Olivier Brandicourt, head of Bayer’s health care business, will have to restore growth in Sanofi’s important diabetes franchise.

headline: In Corporate Crimes, Individual Accountability Is Elusive
snippet: Thanks to Brandon L. Garrett, author of “Too Big to Jail,” we know the notion that the government has been lax on corporate wrongdoers isn’t just folk wisdom.

headline: Questioning the Value of Health Apps
snippet: More than 100,000 apps claim to help consumers track their conditions. That doesn’t mean they are all accurate.

headline: Zoetis Adds Ackman Deputy to Its Board, Avoiding a Fight
snippet: The appointment of William F. Doyle, a top lieutenant at William Ackman’s hedge fund, comes after Pershing said it would hold talks with the veterinary medicine maker.

headline: Biggest Banks Absent From Biggest Deal of Year
snippet: Two independent firms — Centerview Partners and Lazard — served as the sole advisers to Kraft and Heinz.

headline: F.D.A. Reverses Course on 23andMe DNA Test in Move to Ease Restrictions
snippet: The agency approved a test that would be administered to parents to see if they carry mutations that could cause a rare disorder called Bloom syndrome in their children.

headline: Focus on Transportation and Justice System in Connecticut Governor’s Budget
snippet: Gov. Dannel P. Malloy presented a nearly $40 billion two-year budget that proposes to overhaul the aging transportation infrastructure in Connecticut, cuts the state sales tax and revamps the state’s criminal justice system.

headline: How Obama’s Tax Plan May Not Work as Intended
snippet: The president’s proposed offshore earnings tax may fuel an increase in foreign acquisitions of midsize American companies, Victor Fleischer writes in the Standard Deduction column.

headline: High-Tech Fashion Redefines Meaning of Revealing Clothing
snippet: “Cloud Couture,” a show at Pratt Institute’s Brooklyn Fashion and Design Accelerator in Williamsburg, opens up the power and risks of advanced technology and clothing.

headline: Obama’s Budget Seeks International Minimum Tax for Corporations
snippet: A tax on foreign earnings trapped overseas is best thought of as a jobs-friendly international minimum tax, writes Victor Fleischer in the Standard Deduction column.

headline: A Brief Resurrection for a Mural Recalling the Garment Industry’s Heyday
snippet: An exuberant mosaic mural by Max Spivak was uncovered during a renovation at a Manhattan building, but large plastic sheets have been erected in front of it, once again hiding it from passers-by.

headline: How to Develop New Antibiotics
snippet: A $2 billion prize might get scientists to deal with the superbug crisis.

snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

snippet: These three New Jersey confectioneries create chocolate treats, from simple to elaborate, the old-fashioned way.

headline: Tax Reform Is the Cry, Until Details Are Offered
snippet: President Obama’s budget calls for a lower overall tax rate, but also for a one-time 14 percent tax on all cash sitting overseas.

headline: The Drugs That Companies Promote to Doctors Are Rarely Breakthroughs
